intro: Neosasamorpha lasioderma, commonly known as the hairy-leafed neosasamorpha, is a rare flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in the spring. Native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant has a woody stem and produces capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
